title: Add scratch directory to heron docker build
body:
This sets the scratch directory for a build to be $HOME/.heron-compile.
The purpose of this is to not add files to the working directory that
might accidentally get committed while a build is taking place.

This change also checks to make sure the output directory exists and
creates it if it does not already exist.

Resolves https://github.com/twitter/heron/issues/57

title: Add a script to build and compile heron in a container
body:
This adds two separate environment for which heron can be compiled in, ubuntu 14.04 and centos 7.

An example usage of the script would look like:
`docker/build-artifacts.sh ubuntu 0.1.0-SNAPSHOT ./docker`

This will compile heron using the ubuntu docker container, with the version identifier 0.1.0-SNAPSHOT and put the resulting artifacts into the ./docker folder. The output folder can be anywhere but it is worth noting that on OS X the folder must be somewhere under the /Users directory in order for virtual box to properly mount the folder and transfer the artifacts.

This resolves https://github.com/twitter/heron/issues/45

title: Export cpp flags for bazel
body:
Apologies for the overloaded PR here but there were a few things I needed to do to get the build to pass.
1. I made it so libevent was built with the environmental variables in tact. Libevent requires openssl and for El Capitan you need to be able to tell libevent where to find openssl to build correctly. These worked for me:
   
   ```
   export CPPFLAGS="-I/usr/local/opt/openssl/include"
   export LDFLAGS="-L/usr/local/opt/openssl/lib"
   ```
2. I modified the bazel_configure.py script to include CPPFLAGS from the developers environment.
3. I'm not sure this is the correct change but it made the build pass. config/BUILD was failing with 
   
   ```
   /Users/ajorgensen/workspace/heron/heron/common/src/cpp/basics/BUILD:3:1: undeclared inclusion(s) in rule '//heron/common/src/cpp/basics:basics-cxx':
   this rule is missing dependency declarations for the following files included by 'heron/common/src/cpp/basics/sptime.cpp':
   '/Users/ajorgensen/workspace/heron/config/heron-config.h'.
   ```
   
     Removing the genrule from configure/BUILD allowed the build to pass but I am not entirely sure of the implications of doing that and need some guidance in that regard.
